In the Acts of the Apostles, Luke in many places takes care to record this increase of the Christian Church, as a proof of the Divine protection and the power of the Gospel. Thus, ch.v. 14, The multitude of them that believed increas- ed; and xvi. 5, The charches were established, (md increased in numbers daily. It is no sign of Evangelical truth for its professors to propagate their Religion by arnis (as the Ma- hometans do), or by fire and fraud (as the Papists); but when by preaching, or by patience, Religion prevails against those who oppose it, this is a strong argument that Divine assistance is present with its ministers. We have a clear evidence of this in the restoration of the Gospel through Luther and other pious nien, in that it increased daily, whilst the Pope was gnashing liis teeth, and the kings of the earth raging—So far in regard to the diffusion and efficacy of the Gospel.
